page.title: 11LUDWELL VALLEY
page.content: The Ludwell Valley has been newly designated a valley park.It is now a recreation area with sports field,childrens play park,a mixed tree plantation,walking trails and a stream running through,known locally as the Panny.Although the latter is enjoyed by the children it has been used as a rubbish dump. There is a farm where horses,sheep bullocks,a sow and pigletts were seen grazing. We found oak,ash,beech elder maple,rowan,blackthorn,hazel and may- trees,many newly planted. There is a wide variety of the common wildflowers from which we identified 26 species and many different grasses. The mini-beasts found were bees,wasps flies,ladybirds,ants,slugs,snails,and cabbagewhite butterflies.Hedgehogs, rabbits and a slow worm were seen.
